turkey is a country that covers a large

Peninsula
it sits precariously on the Europe Asia

actually is the place I'm staying at is

on a small island of the southwest coast

course Turkey is the birthplace of the

whose formation occurred towards the end

the recent history of Turkey has been a

the division of land between Greece and
Civil War creating many problems

especially during the 1970s and early

tragedy hit this nation in 1999 when a

they say that to truly get away from it
all you must first place yourself is far

away from all the familiar features of

to escape the day-in day-out routine and
shake off the shackles of the rat-race

existence taking the holiday gives your

and your body a well-deserved

we all need a holiday a break a getaway

yeah well I didn't realize it could get

in English the place you travel to is
your destination you set up from your

home and travel to another place you
make a journey you go on a trip you take

a vacation you go on holiday
the average holiday lasts for about two

weeks this is more common if the journey
taken to get there is a long one the

slowest form of long-distance travel is
by sea

the fastest form of transport is of
course the aeroplane these days it is

common for those going on holiday to fly
even if they are traveling within their

own country city hopping by plane is
normal across both Europe and the United

States a short flight is referred to as
short fall while a long flight is often
referred to as long-haul

a plane trip can take anything from a
couple of hours with no stops to a

couple of days with many stops
some people find flying less enjoyable

these days the long delays at airports
and the many security checks that

passengers now face have combined to
make travelling by plane much less of an
adventure than it used to be

for most people summer is the time for
taking a holiday some will stay in their

own country and take a domestic holiday
while others will take a long trip to

another country they will go abroad they
will travel overseas a person may travel

just a few miles to a nearby country or
they might decide to travel to a

completely different part of the world
thousands of miles away

there are many different types of
holiday which can be taken the choice is

yours from relaxing get away from it all
Beach holidays where you simply spend

the time doing as little as possible
right up to the wild adventure holidays

where you spend most of the time
exploring the sites and taking in the

water high up in the air or even deep

spending so much time on the small

island I have decided to take a boat
trip across the bay to the nearest port
on the Turkish mainland called Fethiye

there is nothing like the feeling of

you certainly feel the force of each

Vitya is a small bustling market town it
serves as the main commercial centre for

this particular region on the southeast
corner of the Gulf from here you can

take a sightseeing boat trip or go on a
deep-sea diving adventure the town

attracts hundreds of tourists a week to
its small shops and gifts stalls

despite the mass attraction fethiye does
not feel like a tourist trap the

laid-back feel of the town gives you a
real sense of the nature of the Turkish
people

there are plenty of places to eat with
cafes and restaurants serving all types

of food including a full English
breakfast mmm talking of food surely one

of the best parts of taking a foreign
holiday must be sampling the local

cuisine tasting the local food each
country tends to have its own speciality

dishes some countries have become
connected to certain types of food and

drink for example Italy is known for its
pasta dishes France is known for its

fine wines and high-class restaurants
turkey is well known for its meat dishes

such as kebabs when people talk about
English food they often mention fish and

chips what type of food is your country
famous for

it is worth noting that there is a very
large population of British people
living here in the southwest of Turkey

so now it is time to take the short trip

it would be unfair to talk about travel
without mentioning its impact on the

environment Turkey is a relative
newcomer to the mass tourist industry

and because of this it has not yet been
spoiled by the development connected
with this particular market

there are still many part of this
country which have managed to remain
relatively untouched by progress

however the small island I'm staying on
is now beginning to show signs of the

demand for places to stay new
developments are starting to spring up
in and around this area

fortunately it is still being kept under
tight control so for the time being many

parts of southern turkey remain
relatively unspoiled

the island I'm staying on Chevallier is
steeped in history the ruins of Roman

settlements are scattered along the
coast of the island with some now hidden
beneath the water

here we see an excavation site
archeologists are in the process of

uncovering the remains of just such a
Roman dwelling

some ruins from not so long ago now a
disused restaurant now sits derelict it

would seem that this small island could
not sustain such a business although

that could all change in the future as
more people come here

there is one thing you cannot do much
about on holiday and that is the weather

fortunately storms like this one are not
common during the summer in Turkey the

tourist season here tends to be between
April and October with June to August

being the hottest time when the
temperature can reach 40 degrees

one of the most well known superstitions
in Turkey is the all-seeing benevolent

eye which is said to ward off the evil
intentions and negative thoughts of the

so-called evil eye the benevolent I can
be seen everywhere around Turkey a

person may wear one is a pendant or put
it above the doorway of a room or have

one displayed at the front of their home
the benevolent eyes believed to ward off
all evil intentions

one of the most enjoyable parts of
traveling to any place is of course

taking in the sights and enjoying the
scenery the small island I'm staying on

gives you just such a chance first of
all there are no roads here so all

traveling on the island must be done on
foot a slow walk from one end of the

island to the other takes around 40
minutes and the more adventurous can

swim right around the island in just
under an hour

from here you can see some of the small
villas which have been built the first

modern buildings on the island were
constructed here around the mid-1990s

from here we can see the Turkish
mainland and the town we visited earlier
Fethiye

one of the best parts of staying on an
island of this size must be the feeling

of seclusion it gives you sometimes it
is good to be isolated from others for a

while it gives you time to reflect on
things you would otherwise not have the
chance to consider

you
of course living in isolation does have

its downside there are no shops on the
island and all supplies must be brought
over by boat

surely the most important part of any
holiday must be the accommodation you

can stay in a hotel and have all your
meals included in the price this is

called
full board you may only want a breakfast

included in a deal this is known as bed
and breakfast you may decide to rent

accommodation such as a small villa and
make your own meals this is called a

self catering holiday the hotel I'm
staying at has a nice pool to relax by

for the more adventurous there is a
jetty for those who want to be nearer to

the sea from this point you can enjoy
all of the maritime sights the word

maritime refers to anything sea related

also a word relating to the sea we often
describe all things living in the sea as
marine life
